column4: I got Ubuntu Gutsy and I heard that I have to recompile the kernel for P4, is it right?
no recompiling is necessary
I know that its not necessary to do it but to get the P4 optimization for more speed
well, u could do that, what generation pentium 4 is it? HT?
Its pentium M "centrino", HT
sorry i mean no HT
mkay...well there is some flags in the 2.6.23 kernel for that processor, but unless ur up for a bit of learning, u might forget about it
if you're interested in compiling your own kernel tho i recommend this thread: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=311158
do you think the result worse it?
do you think that this operation will result in much more noticeable speed?
to be honest, from what i've read, the difference wil probably be less than noticeable, however there are other options when compling your kernel to boost performance
thanks a lot
yea, if ur interested, read up on kernel scheduler settings and the 'realtime' kernel
do you know about hard disk load cycle?
mm...not sure what u mean
hard disk load cycle is parking/un parking the hard disk's head to save power when running on battery
each hard disk manufacturar sets an average for its product
the average is 600,000 load cycle then you should replace your hard disk
ohh right, well im not too sure about that as i dont use a laptop currently
ubuntu makes a lot of this cycles per minute more than other OS's
i've heard some about that, but i dont know how to fix it
